org.javautil.text
Class AsString

java.lang.Object
  org.javautil.text.AsString

public class AsString
extends Object

Simple way to get an object formatted as a String. Transients are by default not emitted but don't use the transient qualifier as a means to suppress if you plan on using HashCodeBuilder or EqualsBuilder to build a hash and the field is actually part of the identifier. Configuration is primarily through the flags see

Author:
jjs at dbexperts dot com
See Also:
ToStringStyleFlags, Sample usage 
 
 AsString as = new AsString(DONT_USE_IDENTITY_HASH_CODE,SUPPRESS_TIME);
 logger.debug(as.toString(object);
todo document default values for Configurable
